alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 12:11PM EST until January 12 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Localized flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In Ohio, Adams, Hocking, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1211 PM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding has been reported in portions of Lewis county, as well as near South Bloomingville in Hocking county. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Waverly, Nelsonville, West Union, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Vanceburg, Lucasville, Tollesboro, Hocking Hills State Park, South Bloomingville, Blue Creek, Laurelville, Murray City and Adelphi.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
